title: Commonwealth of the Philippines
summary: The Commonwealth of the Philippines (Spanish: Commonwealth  de Filipinas or Mancomunidad de Filipinas; Tagalog: Kómonwélt ng Pilipinas or Malasariling Pámahalaán ng Pilipinas)[4][5][6][7] was the administrative body that governed the Philippines from 1935 to 1946, aside from a period of exile in the Second World War from 1942 to 1945 when Japan occupied the country.  It replaced the Insular Government, a United States territorial government, and was established by the Tydings–McDuffie Act.[8][9][10][11] The Commonwealth was designed as a transitional administration in preparation for the country's full achievement of independence.[12] Its foreign affairs remained managed by the United States.[13]
